# Utilities-units API

## Code scaffolding

Run `ng generate component component-name --project utilities-units` to generate a new component. You can also use `ng generate directive|pipe|service|class|guard|interface|enum|module --project utilities-units`.

> Note: Don't forget to add `--project utilities-units` or else it will be added to the default project in your `angular.json` file.

## Build

Run `ng build utilities-units` to build the project. The build artifacts will be stored in the `dist/` directory.

## Using npm link For Development and Builds

You can use `npm link` to add local changes from projects managed via npm.
For more information about this, please see [the relevant confluence page](https://confluence.ur.iarobots.net/x/wAFHBQ).

## Publishing

After building your library with `ng build utilities-units`, go to the dist folder `cd dist/utilities-units` and run `npm publish`.

## Running unit tests

Run `ng test utilities-units` to execute the unit tests via [Karma](https://karma-runner.github.io).

## Further help

To get more help on the Angular CLI use `ng help` or go check out the [Angular CLI](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli).
